entries.title: India’s Capex Spending Is Likely to Slow on Lower Tax Haul
entries.description: India’s pace of spending on infrastructure, buildings and other fixed assets will probably slow in the coming fiscal year, a development that could dent the nation’s ability to maintain world-beating growth.

entries.title: Ecuador Fires Twelve CEOs Amid Graft Accusations at State Firms
entries.description: Ecuador’s government fired the CEOs of several major state-owned companies, including oil driller Petroecuador, in response to graft allegations published by a local media outlet.

entries.title: South Korea’s Flirtation With Nuclear Arms Piles Pressure on US
entries.description: Almost as quickly as South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol mentioned last week that his nation might need to acquire nuclear weapons, his office clarified that he had no plans to actually do so.

entries.title: Why Hunter Biden Is Back in the News
entries.description: Hunter Biden, the second-born son of the US president, has a way of staying in the news. His work in Ukraine was a topic of the 2019 phone call that led to the first impeachment of then-President Donald Trump. E-mails and photos taken from his abandoned laptop computer spurred a dispute over whether social media companies censor legitimate news. An investigation of his finances could wind up with him facing criminal charges. If the new Republican majority in the US House of Representatives has i

entries.title: At Davos, Sinema and Manchin High-Five Over Keeping Filibuster Rule
entries.description: Kyrsten Sinema and Joe Manchin — who foiled Democrats’ efforts to pass a voting-rights overhaul by a simple majority — shared a high-five on the stage in Davos as they reaffirmed their opposition to overturning the Senate’s filibuster rule.

entries.title: DOJ Offers 75% Reduction in Fines to Companies That Admit Crimes
entries.description: The Justice Department will recommend as much as a 75% reduction in fines for companies that voluntarily report wrongdoing to the government and fully cooperate with investigations.

entries.title: TikTok Banned From University of Texas Campus on Cybersecurity Concerns
entries.description: The University of Texas at Austin has banned the use of TikTok on the campus’s networks after state and national leaders expressed concerns about the social media app’s ties to China and the large amount of user data it collects.

entries.title: Scholz Brushes Off Talk of Further Joint EU Borrowing — for Now
entries.description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said he still embraces the “Hamiltonian” spirit of deeper fiscal integration for Europe, but he brushed off the idea of more joint borrowing, for now at least.

entries.title: ECB’s Villeroy Says Resilient Economy Makes Rate Hikes Easier
entries.description: European Central Bank Governing Council member Francois Villeroy de Galhau said the resilience of the continent’s economy in the face of the energy crisis makes ramping up interest rates less complicated.

entries.title: Germany Learned Its Lesson From Russia Gas Dependence, Chancellor Scholz Says
entries.description: Germany learned a lesson from the war in Ukraine that it shouldn’t depend on just one country for its energy supplies, Chancellor Olaf Scholz said in an interview.

entries.title: Kissinger Sheds Resistance to Ukraine Joining NATO
entries.description: BERLIN, GERMANY - JANUARY 21: Former United States Secretary of State and National Security Advisor Henry Kissinger attends the ceremony for the Henry A. Kissinger Prize on January 21, 2020 in Berlin, Germany. The annual prize is awarded by the American Academy in Berlin for "outstanding service" to transatlantic relations. The 2019 edition of the award was given to German Chancellor Angela Merkel. (Photo by Adam Berry/Getty Images)

entries.title: Five Key Takeaways From Chancellor Scholz’s Bloomberg Interview
entries.description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz spoke in Berlin Tuesday with Bloomberg News Editor-in-Chief John Micklethwait. Here are the key takeaways from their conversation:

entries.title: German Chancellor Scholz Confident EU Will Avoid US Trade War Over Green Subsidies
entries.description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said he’s convinced that a trade war can be avoided between the European Union and the US over a recent package of green subsidies introduced by Joe Biden’s administration.

entries.title: Santos Will Receive Committee Spots as McCarthy Moves Past GOP Gripes
entries.description: Scandal-plagued Representative George Santos will receive committee assignments, House Speaker Kevin McCarthy said, despite calls from within the New York Republican’s own party to resign.

entries.title: McCarthy Calls For Immediate Negotiations on Budget, Debt Limit
entries.description: House Speaker Kevin McCarthy said President Joe Biden and Senate Democrats need to sit down with Republicans as soon as possible to begin discussing controls on federal spending and lifting the nation’s debt limit.

entries.title: Biden Says US, Dutch in ‘Lockstep’ as He Pushes China Chip Curbs
entries.description: President Joe Biden said the US and Netherlands were working in “lockstep” over their approach to China and would discuss ways to secure global supply chains during a meeting with Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte at the White House.

entries.title: Scholz Says in Talks With Allies About Sending Tanks to Ukraine
entries.description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said he’s in talks with allies over potentially supplying heavy tanks to Ukraine, but cautioned that any announcements would have to come in lockstep with others.

entries.title: French Childbirths Slump, Highlighting Pension Funding Challenge
Ex-EU Lawmaker in Qatar Scandal to Tell Prosecutors About Bribes
entries.description: A former European Parliament member embroiled in the Qatar corruption scandal has agreed to reveal details of the scheme to prosecutors — including who he bribed — in exchange for a reduced jail term.

entries.title: Scholz Sees Germany Avoiding Recession With New Gas Supplies
entries.description: Fresh sources of energy mean Germany’s economy can avoid shrinking this year

entries.title: Netherlands Weighs Sending Patriot Air Defense System to Ukraine
entries.description: The Netherlands is considering sending a Patriot system to Ukraine, joining the US and Germany in bolstering the Ukrainian military arsenal with crucial air defense to fight Russia’s invasion.

entries.title: Cyberattack Disrupts Ukraine Cyber Briefing Feed, Official Says
entries.description: The livestream of a press conference by Ukrainian authorities on Russian hacking was repeatedly interrupted by a cyberattack, according to a senior government official.

entries.title: Meloni Wants New Face for Italy Treasury Job Once Held by Draghi
entries.description: Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni’s government wants a new director general at Italy’s Treasury in a crucial choice for economic policy and managing state-controlled entities, people familiar with the matter said.

entries.title: Supreme Court Rejects Appeal on Use of Covid Aid for Tax Cuts
entries.description: The US Supreme Court turned away a Missouri appeal that sought to ensure states can cut taxes even as they receive $195 billion in federal pandemic-relief money.

entries.title: Maryland’s First Black Governor Gives Democrats Hope After a Biden White House
entries.description: Wes Moore takes office this week as the nation’s third Black state executive

entries.title: Roosevelt-Era Law Gets Revival as FTC Targets Consumer Behemoths
entries.description: Robinson-Patman Act bars price discrimination by suppliers

entries.title: Pakistan’s Former PM Imran Khan Hints at Returning to Parliament
entries.description: Pakistan’s opposition leader Imran Khan has hinted at returning to the parliament after nine months of street protests that couldn’t force Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif to call early elections.

entries.title: Bank Chair Says He’s Against Macron’s Pension Reform in France
entries.description: French President Emmanuel Macron’s pension reform plan faces opposition from the country’s unions, a majority of its citizens, and now from the chairman of one the country’s banks.

entries.title: Shapps Says UK Working to Decouple Gas, Renewable Power Prices
entries.description: The UK is “actively working on” de-coupling gas and renewable energy prices, Business Secretary Grant Shapps said.

entries.title: Grant Shapps Apologizes for ‘Inadvertently’ Airbrushing Boris Johnson Out of Photo
entries.description: Grant Shapps has apologised for "inadvertently" airbrushing former prime minister Boris Johnson out of a photo on Twitter celebrating a space launch in Cornwall.

entries.title: US-China Defense Talks Stalled Two Months After Biden-Xi Meeting
entries.description: The Pentagon is struggling to get China to resume military-to-military talks, according to a senior US defense official, underscoring continuing tensions between the two sides despite last year’s meeting between Presidents Joe Biden and Xi Jinping.

entries.title: Who is Germany’s New Defense Minister, Boris Pistorius?
entries.description: When US Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin travels to Berlin on Jan. 19, he’ll meet for the first time with his new German counterpart, Boris Pistorius. Chancellor Olaf Scholz nominated Pistorius on Tuesday as the successor to Christine Lambrecht, who resigned from her post the day before following a series of missteps.

entries.title: China Is Shrinking But It’s Still Too Big to Fail
entries.description: The mantra “too big to fail” is often applied to banks and companies. But it applies to countries, too.

entries.title: Von der Leyen Says EU Must Boost Clean Tech Funds to Counter US
entries.description: The head of the European Union’s executive arm said the bloc should pass a new law to fast-track investments in clean tech and boost funding for the energy transition in response to a US climate law it fears unfairly subsidizes American companies.

entries.title: US Tanks to Ukraine Would Help Germany Send Leopard, Habeck Says
entries.description: A decision on sending Germany’s Leopard battle tank to Ukraine will be easier if the US sends equivalent vehicles to the war zone too, according to Vice Chancellor Robert Habeck.

entries.title: Indians View US as Biggest Threat After China, Survey Shows
entries.description: Indians view the US as the biggest military threat after China and place greater blame on NATO and Washington than on Vladimir Putin for his war in Ukraine, according to a new survey.

entries.title: Russia to Boost Troops in West With Army Expansion
entries.description: Russia will create new commands near Europe as it expands its military to 1.5 million men amid deepening tensions with the US and its allies over the Kremlin’s invasion of Ukraine.

entries.title: Brexit Rules Cost Britain 330,000 Workers, Economists Say
entries.description: Brexit immigration curbs have led to a shortfall of 330,000 workers in the UK, contributing to a tighter labor market and fueling inflation, a report showed.

entries.title: EU Must Be Realistic About US Climate Act, Trade Chief Says
entries.description: The European Union needs to be “realistic” about being able to resolve its concerns over the US climate law and must prepare its own policy response, Europe’s trade commissioner said.

entries.title: Scholz Nominates Pistorius as Germany’s Next Defense Minister
entries.description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz plans to propose Boris Pistorius as Germany’s new defense minister, filling a critical role in his cabinet after Christine Lambrecht resigned on Monday following a series of missteps.

entries.title: Vietnam President Loses Party Titles in Unprecedented Shakeup
entries.description: Vietnam’s president stepped down and was ousted from the Communist Party’s top bodies in an unparalleled shakeup, as leader Nguyen Phu Trong’s anti-corruption purge casts an ever-widening net.

entries.title: Ukraine Latest: Rescuers Search Rubble for Missing in Dnipro
entries.description: A total of 25 people still remain unaccounted for after a missile strike against an apartment block in the city of Dnipro on Saturday claimed at least 40 lives, according to Dnipropetrovsk region Governor Valentyn Reznichenko.

entries.title: Davos Latest: Germany Sees ‘High Risk’ of Renewed Trade Tensions
entries.description: Members of the global elite are back in Davos in their regular January slot after a three-year hiatus due to the Covid-19 pandemic.

entries.title: Yemen Rebels, Saudis in Back-channel Talks to Maintain Truce
entries.description: Cairo (AP) -- Amid Yemen’s longest-ever pause in fighting — more than nine months — Saudi Arabia and its rival, the Iranian-backed Houthi rebels, have revived back-channel talks, hoping to strengthen the informal cease-fire and lay out a path for a negotiated end to the long civil war, according to Yemeni, Saudi and U.N. officials.

entries.title: South Africa Plans New Law to Accelerate Power Capacity
entries.description: South Africa’s National Energy Crisis Committee, a body run by the office of President Cyril Ramaphosa, expects record power outages to ease as measures put in place, including a new law to fast-track plant development, take effect.

entries.title: Pakistan’s Ruling Coalition Party Upsets Khan in Karachi Vote
entries.description: Pakistan Peoples Party, a major partner in the country’s ruling coalition, won a majority of seats in local government elections in Karachi, the country’s largest city, to upset former Prime Minister Imran Khan in his stronghold.

entries.title: Where Change Is Coming for LGBTQ Rights Around the World
entries.description: Activists expect positive momentum in 2023 for the community as a whole in countries from Brazil to Greece, but worry about friction over transgender people.

entries.title: UK Escalates Feud With Scotland After Gender Equality Law Veto
entries.description: The government’s decision to block a law making it easier for people to change their gender risks widening the rift over the future of the United Kingdom.

entries.title: Spanish Region Is Trying to Make It Harder to Get Abortions
entries.description: The rules are the first example of an attempt to rollback reproductive rights in western Europe since Roe v. Wade was overturned in the US

entries.title: A $50 Billion Overdraft Is Set to Become Nigeria’s Debt
entries.description: Nigerian President Muhammadu Buhari is pushing lawmakers to let him add an unpaid $50 billion overdraft from the central bank to the country’s public debt pile despite concerns about the legality of the borrowing.

entries.title: US-China Trade is Close to a Record, Defying Talk of Decoupling
entries.description: Trade between the US and China is on track to break records, a signal of resilient links between the world’s top economies amid the heated national security rhetoric in Washington and fears of “decoupling.”

entries.title: Japan’s Largest Trade Union Head Says 2023 Is Pivotal for Wages
entries.description: This year is pivotal for the Japanese economy to move away from decades of deflationary thinking toward sustained real wage growth, according to the head of the country’s largest labor union.

entries.title: Hong Kong’s Leader Hopes to End Mandatory Mask Wearing This Year
entries.description: Hong Kong’s leader John Lee is optimistic he can remove the last pandemic curbs including mask wearing this year.

entries.title: China’s Population Starts Shrinking, First Drop Since 1960s
entries.description: China’s population started shrinking in 2022 for the first time in six decades, a milestone for the world’s second-largest economy, which is facing an increasingly serious demographic crisis.

entries.title: Malaysia PM Says 2023 Budget to Consider Rising Debt Level
entries.description: Malaysia seeks to expedite priority projects while plugging leakages in its review of the 2023 budget amid rising sovereign debt levels, according to Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim.

entries.title: Australian Open Bans Russia, Belarus Flags After Audience Outcry
entries.description: Russian and Belarussian flags will be banned from the Australian Open after a confrontation at a match on the first day of the tennis tournament, organizers said Tuesday.
